thread.title: Germany#039;s Oldest Automaker Wants to Challenge Uber
thread.title_full: Germany#039;s Oldest Automaker Wants to Challenge Uber

title: Germany#039;s Oldest Automaker Wants to Challenge Uber
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
16 Sep 2015 02:20 AM EST 
Germany’s oldest automaker doesn’t just want to become the Uber of something. It now actually wants to be Uber, or at least Uber XL. Daimler, maker of Mercedes, is reportedly considering launching an on-demand limo service using driverless cars. The plan, confirmed by CEO Dieter Zetsche at a Mercedes-Benz event on the eve of the Frankfurt auto show. Fleets of autonomous vehicles would serve people who don’t want to own a car but still desire “premium transportation services,” like limousines. Zetsche did not say where the service would first run. Daimler already runs car-sharing service car2go, similar to Zipcar, which lets users find parked rental cars nearby. Daimler has already prototyped an autonomous sedan, and truck. They also own a high-definition mapping service, HERE, and a taxi service not dissimilar to Uber, called MyTaxi, which allows customers to hail a cab on their smartphones.
